Description: Black-topped red ware bowl with a slightly inturned irregular rim and a rounded, slightly flattened, base; reddish-brown fabric fired black on the upper half of the interior surface and just over the exterior rim, the lower section of the interior surface is greyish in colour, a series of rough crisscross lines have been deeply incised in a single register on the exterior below the rim. Handmade. Complete.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Northern Dongola Reach, Site P37 Grave (F3) Context 20d
Type series: NDRS type BU5.2 (published form type series number)
Bibliographic references: Welsby Sjöström 2001a / The Pottery from the Survey (p.308, fig. 5.39)
Welsby Sjöström 2001b / Pottery from the Kerma Moyen graves at Site P37 (page 350, fig. 6.2)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sudan Archaeological Research Society
Division of Finds: National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums (NCAM)
Acquisition notes: Division of finds from the National Corporation for Antiquities and Museums, Khartoum to SARS, the license holder.
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 1343x (excavation type series number)
